meanings.definition: In a state of complete absorption or deep concentration.
meanings.sent1: She was tranced by the beautiful music playing in the background.
meanings.sent2: The students were tranced by the fascinating story their teacher was telling.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed tranced by the laser pointer, chasing it around the room endlessly.
meanings.sent4: His eyes were tranced on the horizon, lost in thought about the future.
meanings.sent5: The painting was so captivating that it left viewers tranced in admiration.

meanings.definition: To put into a trance or hypnotic state.
meanings.sent1: The hypnotist tranced the audience with his mesmerizing performance.
meanings.sent2: She tranced her friend into a deep sleep using a relaxation technique.
meanings.sent3: The magician tranced the volunteer, making him believe he was floating in the air.
meanings.sent4: The therapist tranced her patient to help him overcome his fear of flying.
meanings.sent5: The shaman tranced the tribe members during the ritual, connecting them to the spirit world.
